title: [Large-scale] Deep Learning-Based Active Learning Strategies for Quantitative MR Spectroscopy

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational MR spectroscopy theory, basic signal processing knowledge, and experience in statistical analysis
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course designed to enhance practitioners' competency in analyzing MR (Magnetic Resonance) spectroscopy data in real clinical environments

learning_goals: Learners can build MR spectroscopy quantification models using 1D frequency-domain and 2D time-frequency spectrogram data
Learners can optimize learning data distribution and improve model performance by over 15% using active learning techniques
Learners can comparatively evaluate the accuracy/precision of deep learning predictions and existing model fitting (MF) techniques under varying SNR conditions
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
